narrative: In the terrestrial realms, where the forest stretch far and wide, there dwells the Aardvark, a other of note. It keeps to a omnivore fare, taking sustenance as the wilds afford. No yoke nor leash has tamed it, for it prospers without the aid of men. It is mild of temper, wandering free of sworn domain, and offers a low hazard to the heedless. Those who seek its tablefare take the meat, ever mindful it must be cooked thoroughly. From its form are drawn meat and hide, which merchants and craftsmen prize. Thus does the Aardvark move through legend and living world alike, keeping the balance of nature and stirring wonder in those who behold it.

domestication.notes: Kept for milk, meat, and hides

edibility.preparation_notes: Chevon stewed; milk made into tangy cheeses

narrative: In the terrestrial realms, where the farmland and hills stretch far and wide, there dwells the Goat, a mammal of note. It keeps to a herbivore and browser fare, taking sustenance as the wilds afford. Long has it abided beside the hearths of humankind, knowing the touch of halter and hand. It is mild of temper, wandering free of sworn domain, and offers a low hazard to the heedless. Those who seek its tablefare take the meat, ever mindful it must be roasted or stewed. From its form are drawn meat, hide and horsehair, which merchants and craftsmen prize. Thus does the Horse move through legend and living world alike, keeping the balance of nature and stirring wonder in those who behold it.
reproduction_notes: Mares foal once yearly after a long spring gestation

edibility.preparation_notes: Stewed or smoked; milk boiled or churned

byproducts.notes: Dressed weight from a mature animal
Cured into thick leather for harness and shields

narrative: In the wetlands transitional and terrestrial realms, where the marshes, floodplains and farmland stretch far and wide, there dwells the Water Buffalo, a mammal of note. It keeps to a herbivore and grazer fare, taking sustenance as the wilds afford. Long has it abided beside the hearths of humankind, knowing the touch of halter and hand. It is mild of temper, staunch in guarding its bounds, and offers a moderate hazard to the heedless. Those who seek its tablefare take the meat and milk, ever mindful it must be stewed or smoked; milk boiled or churned. From its form are drawn milk, meat and hide, which merchants and craftsmen prize. Its broad back and steady pull are famed in wet paddies, hauling plows and carts where horses falter. Thus does the Water Buffalo move through legend and living world alike, keeping the balance of nature and stirring wonder in those who behold it.
reproduction_notes: Cows calve every other year after a long wet-season gestation
